post.body: we don`t have Safeway here, but I`m thinking about making my own peanut butter. Can`t be that hard.
This is true. I`m just a big kid myself because that was my snack too. :D
You`re more than welcome to join us . . . might be a bit of a commute, though! lol
Are you telling me that even our computers are in sync? That`s just bizarre!
lol, we could really wreak some havoc on the world, alright! I ordered my battery about two weeks ago. :)
I ordered mine on ebay. It has yet to arrive, thanks to Christmas mail.
It does suck. My hubby is a musician. Misses ALL the holidays. :(
You`re coming here? Sweet! We definitely have to meet up!
Just in a coffeeshop. I`ll be taking my laptop and going to spend a few uninterrupted hours writing. :)
Amazing how entertaining water can be, isn`t it?
Not to mention, they`re not screaming and fighting. That`s a huge bonus. ;)
Brother-in-law just stopped by to borrow a movie. I think he`s fixing to stay for dinner, he keeps sniffing very deeply and saying, "Wow.Yum
Making two kinds of ribs for hubby . . . maple mustard and BBQ. Hope he likes them!
Sons are watching Prince Caspian and my 3 year old thinks they should do away with swords and get guns. Where does he get this stuff?
Late snack tonight is . . . a spoonful of peanut butter. Why would I cook when kids just eat everything straight up? :)
My house is full of cornflakes. I swear those suckers multiply when touched by a toddler. I`m going to be cleaning them for months.
When did my baby get tall enough to reach lightswitches and taps? This whole growing up business is going to have to stop.
Having some tea. Happy New Year to everyone. A little late, but hey, I`ve been working! :D
Here`s a seriously powerful blog: http://kissesfromkatie.blogspot.com
It`s so nice to have my kids happy tonight! They are running and jumping and laughing together and it`s just so nice!
